custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user does not have a favorite team set
and taps on Stats from bottom nav bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Stats page opens to Player Stats (default) for the given year

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has a favorite team set
and taps on More menu on the bottom 
and then taps on Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Stats page opens to Player Stats (default) for the given year

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Player Stats drop down menu
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user sees a menu for Individual Player Stats and Team Total Stats

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Stats page and set to Player Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see segment controller for Batting, Pitching, and Fielding

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Stats page and set to Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see segment controller for Batting, Pitching, and Fielding

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has no favorite team set and is on the Stats page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the default At Bat color (blue) will show for the segment controller and filters

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a favorite team set and it is on the Stats page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team color will show for the segment controller and filters

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the league button (filter)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a page with a header with Done and no header title on the page ("League" removed)

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has no favorite team set and taps on the League button (filter)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to filter by league (MLB, American League, National League) or team (all 30 teams, by division)

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a favorite team set and taps on the League button (filter)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to filter by league (MLB, American League, National League) or favorite team(s) or teams (all 30 teams, by division)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on the League button (filter) and taps on a team

Test for all 30 clubs
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the Player Stats for that team (three letter team abreviation) with a  segment controller for (Batting, Pitching, Fielding) and filters (season, year)

Test for all 30 clubs

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the League button (filter) and taps on a league or team and then taps on the league/team button (filter) again
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a check mark next to the league or team they tapped on

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Game Type button (filter)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to select a different game type to filter by (Sprint Training, Regular Season, Postseason, World Series, LCS, Division Series, Wild Card)

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Year button (filter)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user will be able to select a All-Time Regular Season Leaders and Leaders by Year to filter by

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on one of the segmented controls (Batting, Pitching, Fielding)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can confirm that they are brought to the respective Stat Page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on Batting segment controller for Player Stats

Repeat by selecting Leagues and Teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can confirm the following categories will be visible: AVG, HR, RBI, SB, R, OBP, SLG, OPS, H, 2B, 3B, BB, SO, CS, G, AB

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on the Pitching segment controller for Player Stats

Repeat by selecting Leagues and Teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can confirm the following categories will be visible: ERA, W, SO, SV, WHIP, BAA, IP, CG, GS, L, SVO, ER, R, H, HR, BB

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on the Fielding segment controller for Player Stats

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on an individual stat button

Repeat by selecting Leagues and Teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of leaders for that particular stat will display accurately

custom_steps_separated.content:
When an individual stat leader page opens

Repeat by selecting Leagues and Teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of 25 players will be returned initially from best to worst for that particular stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on individual stat category for Player Stats
and continues to scroll
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next batch of players will be returned for that particular stat

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user views an individual stat category with more than one person tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Individual Stat will display "X tied" (where X is the number of players tied)

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on an individual stat category with more than one person tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an individual stat page will open and each player tied will have the same position number to the left of their name

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on individual stat category with more than one person tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next position after the tied players will start at "x" after where "x" is the number of players that were tied.

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on an individual stat category and stat page opens
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the filter is displayed properly above the list of players

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Stats page and we select More menu on the bottom
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the More section will be visible

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Stats page and we lost connection (WIFI or cellular)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a Tap to Refresh message will appear

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Stats page and we change the stats with the filter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the spinner should be visible during the transition

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Player Stats and taps on Team Total Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then Team Total Stats are displayed in the main view

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Batting segment controller for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can confirm the following categories will be visible: AVG, HR, RBI, SB, R, OBP, SLG, OPS, H, 2B, 3B, BB, SO, CS, G, AB

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Pitching segment controller for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can confirm the following categories will be visible: ERA, W, SO, SV, WHIP, BAA, IP, CG, GS, L, SVO, ER, R, H, HR, BB

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Fielding segment controller for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can confirm the following categories will be visible: G, GS, INN, TC, PO, A, E, DP, SB, CS, SBPCT, PB, C_WP, FPCT

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on an individual stat category for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of leaders for that particular stat will display accurately

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on individual stat category for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of 25 teams will be returned initially from best to worst for that particular stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on individual stat category for Team Stats
and continues to scroll
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next batch of teams will be returned for that particular stat

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on Team Totals Stats page and more than one team is tied for a category
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Individual Stat will display "x" tied

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the stat category where more than one team is tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then each team will have the same position number to the left of their name

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user scrolls through stat category where more than one team is tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next position after the tied teams will start at "x" after where "x" is the number of teams that were tied.

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user changes a filter on the Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then ensure the filter has filtered correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Search icon in the top right of the Stats view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a search bar will appear at the top of the Stats view
And the Stats view will be cleared out
And the cursor will be in the Search field
And the keyboard will be present
And a segmented control containing Active and Historical will be present
And Active will be selected by default

custom_steps_separated.content: When Active is selected and the user types in two or more letters into the Search field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a search will be performed once the second letter is typed
And that set of results will become more defined as the user types in more letters

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user enters three or more letters into the Search field
And begins to backspace (while leaving 2 or more letters)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the results will update to include a larger set of results based on the letters remaining

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user enters three or more letters into the Search field
And beings to backspace until there is only one letter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the results will be removed from the view once there are less than two letters remaining

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user enters a Player's name
And taps the X button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Search field is cleared out

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user searches for a Player and results are returned
And the user begins to scroll through the results
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the keyboard will dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user searches for a Player
And then taps the Search button on the keyboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the keyboard will dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user searches for a First Name (such as "Michael" or "Greg")
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all players with a First Name AND Last Name that meet the criteria will be returned (such as Michael Cuddyer and Jason Michaels, or Greg Holland and Kevin Gregg/Luke Gregerson)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views a Player result in the list on the Active tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player's headshot will appear
And the Player's name will appear
And the Player's team will appear below their name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user searches for an Active Player who is not on a team's 40-man roster
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player will be returned in the search
And the last known team will be displayed under their name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a Player in the Active search results
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player Card for that player will open
And tapping back will return the user to the results they were previously viewing

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user searches for a Player on the Active tab and results are returned
And then the user switches to the Historical tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then results are returned on the Historical tab

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Historical tab
And performs a search of two letters or more
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a search will be performed once the second letter is typed
And that set of results will become more defined as the user types in more letters

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the results of a search on the Historical tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player's headshot will appear
And the Player's name will appear

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user performs a search on the Active OR Historical view
And a Player is returned who does not have a mugshot
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the default silhouette will appear as a default image

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a Player from a Historical search
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player card for that player will appear
And taping back will take the user back to the search results they were previously viewing

title: Player Search -> Search Icon
custom_steps:
Given the user is on the stats view
When the user taps on the Search icon in the top right of the Stats view
custom_expected:
Then a search bar will appear at the top of the Stats view
And the Stats view will be cleared out
And the cursor will be in the Search field
And the keyboard will be present
And a segmented control containing Active and Historical will be present
And Active will be selected by default

title: Player Search -> Two Letters
custom_steps:
Given the user is on the stats view
When Active is selected and the user types in two or more letters into the Search field
custom_expected:
Then a search will be performed once the second letter is typed
And that set of results will become more defined as the user types in more letters

title: Player Search -> Three Letters
custom_steps:
Given the user is on the stats view
When the user taps on the Search icon in the top right of the Stats view
and the user enters three or more letters into the Search field
And begins to backspace (while leaving 2 or more letters)
custom_expected: Then the results will update to include a larger set of results based on the letters remaining

title: Player Search -> Three Letters -> Backspace to One Letter
custom_steps:
Given the user enters three or more letters into the Search field
And beings to backspace until there is only one letter
custom_expected: Then the results will be removed from the view once there are less than two letters remaining

title: Player Search -> Enter Text -> Tap X Button
custom_steps:
Given the user enters a Player's name
And taps the X button
custom_expected: Then the Search field is cleared out

title: Player Search -> Keyboard Dismissal
custom_steps:
Given the user searches for a Player and results are returned
And the user begins to scroll through the results
And the user searches for a Player
And then taps the Search button on the keyboard
custom_expected: Then the keyboard will dismiss

title: Player Search -> Player First Name
custom_steps: When the user searches for a First Name (such as "Michael" or "Greg")
custom_expected: Then all players with a First Name AND Last Name that meet the criteria will be returned (such as Michael Cuddyer and Jason Michaels, or Greg Holland and Kevin Gregg/Luke Gregerson)

title: Player Search -> Player Result
custom_steps: Given the user views a Player result in the list on the Active tab
custom_expected:
Then the Player's headshot will appear
And the Player's name will appear
And the Player's team will appear below their name

title: Player Search -> Player Not on 40 Man Roster
custom_steps: Given the user searches for an Active Player who is not on a team's 40-man roster
custom_expected:
Then the Player will be returned in the search
And the last known team will be displayed under their name

title: Player Search -> User Taps Active Player
custom_steps: Given the taps on a Player in the Active search results
custom_expected:
Then the Player Card for that player will open
And tapping back will return the user to the results they were previously viewing

title: Player Search -> Active to Historical Tab
custom_steps:
Given the user searches for a Player on the Active tab and results are returned
When the user switches to the Historical tab
custom_expected: Then results are returned on the Historical tab

title: Player Search -> Historical Tab-> Search Two or More Letters
custom_steps:
Given the user taps the Historical tab
And performs a search of two letters or more
custom_expected:
Then a search will be performed once the second letter is typed
And that set of results will become more defined as the user types in more letters

title: Player Search -> Historical Tab -> Results
custom_steps: Given the user views the results of a search on the Historical tab
custom_expected:
Then the Player's headshot will appear
And the Player's name will appear

title: Player Search -> Player Does Not Have Mugshot
custom_steps:
Given a user performs a search on the Active OR Historical view
And a Player is returned who does not have a mugshot
custom_expected: Then the default silhouette will appear as a default image

custom_steps:
Given a user does not have a favorite team set
and taps on Stats from bottom nav bar
custom_expected: Then the Stats page opens to Player Stats (default) for the given year

and then taps on Stats
custom_expected: hen the Stats page opens to Player Stats (default) for the given year

custom_expected: Then the user sees a menu for Individual Player Stats and Team Total Stats

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on an individual stat button

Repeat by selecting Leagues and Teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of leaders for that particular stat will display accurately on the right pane

custom_steps_separated.content:
When an individual stat leader page opens

Repeat by selecting Leagues and Teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of 25 players will be returned initially from best to worst for that particular stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on individual stat category for Player Stats
and continues to scroll
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next batch of players will be returned for that particular stat

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user views an idvidual stat category with more than one person tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Individual Stat will display "X tied" (where X is the number of players tied)

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on an individual stat category with more than one person tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an individual stat page will open and each player tied will have the same position number to the left of their name

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on individual stat category with more than one person tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next position after the tied players will start at "x" after where "x" is the number of players that were tied.

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on an individual stat category and stat page opens
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the filter is displayed properly above the list of players

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Stats page and we select More menu on the bottom
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the More section will be visible

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Stats page and we lost connection (WIFI or cellular)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a Tap to Refresh message will appear

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Stats page and we change the stats with the filter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the spinner should be visible during the transition

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Player Stats and taps on Team Total Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then Team Total Stats are displayed in the main view

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Batting segment controller for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can confirm the following categories will be visible: AVG, HR, RBI, SB, R, OBP, SLG, OPS, H, 2B, 3B, BB, SO, CS, G, AB

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Pitching segment controller for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can confirm the following categories will be visible: ERA, W, SO, SV, WHIP, BAA, IP, CG, GS, L, SVO, ER, R, H, HR, BB

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Fielding segment controller for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can confirm the following categories will be visible: G, GS, INN, TC, PO, A, E, DP, SB, CS, SBPCT, PB, C_WP, FPCT

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on an individual stat category for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of leaders for that particular stat will display accurately

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on individual stat category for Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of 25 teams will be returned initially from best to worst for that particular stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on individual stat category for Team Stats
and continues to scroll
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next batch of teams will be returned for that particular stat

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on Team Totals Stats page and more than one team is tied for a category
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Individual Stat will display "x" tied

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the stat category where more than one team is tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then each team will have the same position number to the left of their name

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user scrolls through stat category where more than one team is tied
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next position after the tied teams will start at "x" after where "x" is the number of teams that were tied.

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user changes a filter on the Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then ensure the filter has filtered correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user selects a team in the Team Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the filter is displayed properly above the list of teams

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Search icon in the top right of the Stats filter view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a search bar will appear at the top of the Stats view
And the Stats filter view will be cleared out
And the cursor will be in the Search field
And the keyboard will be present
And a segmented control containing Active and Historical will be present
And Active will be selected by default

custom_steps_separated.content: When Active is selected and the user types in two or more letters into the Search field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a search will be performed once the second letter is typed
And that set of results will become more defined as the user types in more letters

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user enters three or more letters into the Search field
And begins to backspace (while leaving 2 or more letters)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the results will update to include a larger set of results based on the letters remaining

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user enters three or more letters into the Search field
And beings to backspace until there is only one letter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the results will be removed from the view once there are less than two letters remaining

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user enters a Player's name
And taps the Cancel button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Search field is cleared out
And the results that were previously displaying are cleared out

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user enters a Player's name
And taps the X button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Search field is cleared out

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user searches for a Player and results are returned
And the user begins to scroll through the results
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the keyboard will dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user searches for a Player
And then taps the Search button on the keyboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the keyboard will dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user searches for a First Name (such as "Michael" or "Greg")
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all players with a First Name AND Last Name that meet the criteria will be returned (such as Michael Cuddyer and Jason Michaels, or Greg Holland and Kevin Gregg/Luke Gregerson)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views a Player result in the list on the Active tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player's headshot will appear
And the Player's name will appear
And the Player's team will appear below their name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user searches for an Active Player who is not on a team's 40-man roster
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player will be returned in the search
And the last known team will be displayed under their name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a Player in the Active search results
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player Card for that player will open
And tapping back will return the user to the results they were previously viewing

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user searches for a Player on the Active tab and results are returned
And then the user switches to the Historical tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then results are returned on the Historical tab

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Historical tab
And performs a search of two letters or more
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a search will be performed once the second letter is typed
And that set of results will become more defined as the user types in more letters

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the results of a search on the Historical tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player's headshot will appear
And the Player's name will appear

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user performs a search on the Active OR Historical view
And a Player is returned who does not have a mugshot
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the default silhouette will appear as a default image

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a Player from a Historical search
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Player card for that player will appear
And taping back will take the user back to the search results they were previously viewing

title: Stats - Navigation Button - Layout
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps: When a user taps on Stats
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a Summary view with Navigation Buttons, Stats Filters, Stats Content on the left
and a Details view on the right

title: Stats - Navigation - Summary View
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user taps on Stats from bottom tab menu
and is viewing the Summary section (left)
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the MLB.TV button (or back button if from More Menu)
and a Player Stats/Team Totals button
and a Player Search button
then 3 separate Stat filters (MLB/Team, Season Type, Time Frame)
and a segment controller for Batting, Pitching, Fielding stats
and a List View of the summary of results

title: Stats - Navigation - Details View
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps: When a user taps on a stat category in the Summary view
custom_expected:
Then stat category opens in the into the Details View
and the stat category title is displayed in the header
and the category leaders be displayed in descending order

title: Stats - Navigation - Player Search
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats page
and taps on the Player Search
custom_expected:
Then a modal will open with:
-a Player Search box
-a Cancel button
-Segment controller for Active and Historical
-Search result rows

title: Stats - Navigation - MLB.TV (Tab Bar entry)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps: When a user taps on Stats from the bottom tab menu
custom_expected:
Then the MLB.TV button is present in the upper left
and tapping on it will open MLB.TV view

title: Stats - Navigation - MLB.TV (More menu entry)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps: When a user enters Stats from the More Menu
custom_expected: Then the MLB.TV button will not present in the view

title: Stats - Navigation - Gameday Audio button
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps: When a user is on the Stats page
custom_expected: Then the Gameday Audio button will be in the upper right corner of the Details view

title: Stats - Stat Filters
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps: When a user taps on a stat filter

custom_steps_separated.content: on an iPhone or iPad in compact view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a Modal will open with a Done button
and the specified Title in the Navigation bar
and each row indicates a selectable option

custom_steps_separated.content: on an iPad (not in compact view)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a Popover will open 
and the specified Title in the Navigation bar
and each row indicates a selectable option

title: Stats - Stat Filters - Select Filter
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on Stats
and taps on a Stats Filter
custom_expected: Then the Summary Stats and Details View are reset and refreshed

title: Stats - Stat Filter - Individual
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user taps on Stats
and taps on the Player Stats
custom_expected:
Then the user will have a option for:
-Individual Player Stats
-Team Total Stats

title: Stats - Individual Player Stats - Filters
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on Stats
and has Player Stats selected
and taps on MLB filter
custom_expected:
Then the user will be able to select:
-By League (MLB, AL, NL)
-Favorite Team(s) (if selected)
-Individual Team (sorted by division)

title: Stats - Individual Player Stats - Filters
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on Stats page
and is viewing Individual Player Stats
and taps on Regular Season filter
custom_expected:
Then the user will have option for:
Spring Training, Regular Season, Postseason, LCS, Division Series, Wild Card

title: Stats - Individual Player Stats - Filters
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats page
and is viewing Individual Player Stats
and taps on the year filter
custom_expected:
Then the user can filter by:
-All-Time Regular Season Leaders (Career Total, Single Season, Career Total Active Only, Single Season Active Only)
-List all years from 1871 to the Current Season as per the App Config

custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats page
and is viewing the Team Total Stats
and taps on MLB filter
custom_expected:
Then the user can choose:

and taps on the Regular Season filter
custom_expected:
Then the user can choose:
Spring Training, Regular Season, Postseason, LCS, Division Series, Wild Card

custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats page
and is viewing the Team Total Stats
and taps on Year filter
custom_expected:
Then the user can choose from:
-List all years from 1871 to the Current Season as per the App Config

title: Stats - Player Stats - Config Value
custom_preconds:
Download and local map to the following file:
http://qa-atbatappconfig.mlb.com/ios/9.4.0/iphoneConfig.json
http://qa-atbatappconfig.mlb.com/ios/9.4.0/ipadConfig.json

Adjust the following settings:
statsSeason: 2016
defaultStatsGameType: 2

Based off of these defaultStatsType values:
* 1  Exhibition
* 2  Spring Training
* 4  Regular Season
* 8  Postseason (Combined) - This shows as just "Postseason".
* 16  World Series
* 32  League Championship Series
* 64  Division Series
* 128  Wild Card
* 256  Game Type Max
custom_steps:
When a user has iOS At Bat installed
and a user is on the Stats page
and the app config has been set to default to a specific stat filter(s)
custom_expected: Then when user enters Stats to that specific filter

title: Stats - Segmented Control
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats page
and views the segmented control under then filters
custom_expected:
Then the user can change the Stat Type to Batting, Pitching, Fielding
by tapping in the segmented controller
or swiping right/left

title: Stats - Stat Type - Batting (iPAD)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device (iPAD)
custom_steps:

and is on the Batting stat type
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the following categories in the summary view:
AVG, HR, RBI, SB, R, OBP, SLG, OPS, H, 2B, 3B, BB, SO, CS, G, AB

title: Stats - Stat Type - Pitching (iPAD)

custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats page
and taps on the Pitching segmented control
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the following categories in the summary view:
ERA, W, SO, SV, WHIP, BAA, IP, CG, G, GS, L, SVO, ER, R, H, HR, BB

custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats page
and taps on the Fielding segmented control
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the following categories in the summary view:
G, GS, INN, TC, PO, A, E, DP, SB, CS, SBPCT, PB, C_WP, FPCT, RF

title: Stats - Summary View - Player Stat Row Data (iPAD)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device (iPAD)
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing the row data of the Summary view
and is on the Player Stats filter
custom_expected:
Then the user will see:
-Short name of the Statistic (AVG, HR)
-Player Name (Last Name, First Initial)
-Player's Team
-Stat

title: Stats - Summary View - Team Totals Row Data (iPAD)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device (iPAD)
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing the row data of the Summary view
and is on the Team Total filter
custom_expected:
Then the user will see:
-Short name of the Statistic (AVG, HR)
-Team Name
-Stat

title: Stats - Summary View - Tied Row Data (iPAD)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device (iPAD)
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing the row data of the Summary view
and is on the Player or Team Total filter
and one category has multiple leaders
custom_expected:
Then the user will see:
-Short name of the Statistic (AVG, HR)
-<Number> Tied
-Stat

title: Stats - No Data (iPAD)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device (iPAD)
custom_steps:
When a user sets a specific time frame and/or filter
and no data is available
custom_expected: Then the user will receive a message: No Results

title: Stats - Summary View - Empty/Error for a Category (iPAD)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device (iPAD)
custom_steps:
When a user is on Stats
and uses a specific filter(s)
and one category has empty or error data
custom_expected:
Then the data in the specific Summary Statistic has a "-" for name and statistic
and the team is blank

MLB | Regular Season | 1995
a few categories have empty data

Set filters:
(MLB, Regular Season, 1995)

title: Stats - Details View - Player Stats Row Details (iPAD)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device (iPAD)
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats view
and taps on a player stat from the Summary View
custom_expected:
Then the user will seeing the following in each row:
-Rank 
-Mug Shot
-Player name (Last Name, First Initial)
-Team
-Stat Total

title: Stats - Details View - Team Total Row Details (iPAD)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device (iPAD)
custom_steps:
When a user is on the stats view
and taps on a team stat from the Summary View
custom_expected:
Then the user will seeing the following in each row:
-Rank 
-Team Name
-Stat Total

title: Stats - Details View - Tied Row Detail (iPAD)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device (iPAD)
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats view
and is taps on a stat category from the Summary view
and the stat category opens in the Detail view
custom_expected:
If tied, all players with the tie get the same rank
and the next player is listed using their position in the list (1 based index / not zero-based, so if 4 tied for first, next player is ranked 5.)

title: Stats - Detail View - No Data
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats view
and their are no stats available
custom_expected:
If no data is available, present message in the view: "No Results"

TB | Regular Season | 1995
Batting, Pitching, Fielding all have No Results

title: Stats - Summary View - Initial Launch
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats view
and the user enters the Summary Stats view
custom_expected: Then the default Stats Filters are displayed and fresh data is loaded

title: Stats - Data - Cache Bust
custom_preconds: Given a user is on the
custom_steps: When a user swipes down from the top of the list
custom_expected: Then new data is refreshed

title: Stats > Low Connectivity > Data Loading
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats page
and the the data is loading
custom_expected:
Then a spinner is displayed
but the filters are still available on the screen

title: Stats > Low Connectivity > Time Out
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iOS device
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats view
and has low connectivity
but not in Airplane mode
custom_expected:
Then the data load will timeout after 30 seconds
and on timeout the last available data will display
and the following UI Alert will be displayed:

Message: "Low Connectivity: using last available data"
Button: "OK"

title: Stats > Accessibility
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iOS device
and Voiceover is turned on (iOS Settings > Accessibility)
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Stats
and taps or scrolls through parts of the Stats page
custom_expected: Then Stats and categories should be Accessibility friendly

title: Team Page Team Info Section
custom_steps:
1. Open At Bat
2. Tap "More" to open More Menu
3. Tap "Teams" to open team picker
4. Select any team to launch that team page
5. Scroll to [Team] Info section
6. Tap "Stats"
custom_expected: Opens team-specific Player Stats page
